>Perfect Chaos immediately has his anger quelled by Super Sonic

The days grow colder, the nights grow longer. That means /co/ Christmas cheer is coming to town. Grab some cocoa, turn on the Christmas music, get comfy, and hang out with some /co/mrades as we share stories and get into the holiday spirit.

As previous years, share your Amazon wishlist and some random Anon may purchase a holiday gift for you. Be sure to gift another Anon in return so we can spread the cheer far and wide.

Please check the Pastebin to learn how to get your wishlist code, add a shipping address, the benefits of using AmazonSmile, and all other information.

Last year we had 132 gifted anons, some more than once.

Ungifted lists: pastebin.com/SmVHgMRE
All lists: pastebin.com/ZCXuvfE5

To get your wishlist code, open your wishlist on Amazon, then copy the 11 digit number from the link. It will look like this: amazon.com/hz/wishlist/ls/###########
We just need the ###########

Missing Address: When viewing your list, click the "…" in the upper right hand corner. From there click "Manage List" which will give you a few options including “Shipping Address”. While you’re here please check “Third party shipping agreement”. That will allow anons to buy you stuff that isn’t sold by amazon.

Actual depression is rarely for a specific reason. It's different from feeling bummed about something. While there may be an event that kicks things off, it's the chemical imbalance that makes you spiral. Some people have a genetic predisposition towards depression, but a significant number of people do it to themselves with unhealthy coping mechanisms. While they make you feel better in the short term, the quick fix makes things worse in the long run.

He wasn't saying that you can never smoke, masturbate, or eat fast food. It's just that if you're in a rut, those things aren't going to help pull you out of it and will actually make it worse. Eating better, getting some exercise and sunshine, taking care of your hygiene, and talking with friends are better ways to cope, but they take effort.

I don't know why this one schizo is so mad about this. Charlie wasn't wrong.

com:
>What is this thread?
Every Wins'day at Win-O'-Clock we gather here and post links to the latest scans and rips of comic books.
Most links we uploaded ourselves, others we are sharing from elsewhere.
Some comics we've even purchased ourselves (but most we didn't).
If you'd like to help out, just ask and we would be delighted to tell you how.
Otherwise, be patient, be polite, and understand the simple concept behind these words: Not posted means not available yet.

>Where can I find old Win-O'-Threads?
http://desuarchive.org/co/search/subject/Official%20Win-O'-Thread/
http://boards.fireden.net/co/search/subject/Official%20Win-O'-Thread/
(Note: This finds the OP for old threads. If you want to search for comics in the archive, clear the subject field!)

>Where can I find downloads for other comics?
Warez forums/blogs, DDL-indexing search engines (like FilesLoop), torrent trackers (like 1337x) and other P2P networks (like DC++).
If a link has been posted on 4chan, you can search for it in the Desu archive (add "http*" to searches to return only posts with links).
If all else fails, just >buy it.

>Where can I buy comics?
http://www.amazon.com/
On the various publishers' webstores, and at your local comics shop.

>Where can I find an LCS?
http://www.comicshoplocator.com/

>Where can I find out when new comics are released?
http://www.comiclist.com/index.php
http://www.previewsworld.com

>How do I download from websites that only give me .exe files?
Untick the checkbox under the download button.

>How can I find this thread every week?
If you are using the inline extension go to http://4chan.org/co/official or use the option under "Filters & Post Hiding".
If you have 4chanX go to Settings > Filter > Subject and add the following line:
/Official Win-O'-Thread/;highlight

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
>>134473404
Savage Sword was a magazine series, after Marvel had success with several magazine anthology books which had Conan stories in them. Because it was a magazine, SSOC didn't have to deal with the Comic Code Authority, which was a major buzz-kill for Conan the Barbarian in terms of limiting the violence and gore and moral ambiguity of the Howard novels and banned them from doing gratuitous nudity.

SSOC was in general, darker, edgier, and more sexually explicit than the Conan comic. It also had no real set continuity in that it skipped all over the life of Conan, adapting the Howard novels and original stories told at various points in Conan's life. The comic tended to be more or less set in Conan's salad days as a wandering mercenary/thief with the occasional flashback story, while the later day Conan stuff when he became King, was featured in comic format in Conan the King/King Conan.

Savage Sword and Conan proper never crossed over because of the fact that SSOC was "uncensored" Conan, but in the late 80s, Marvel put out a magazine reprint series that was called "The Conan Saga" which reprinted the Conan comic and SSOC in chronological order relating to the life of Conan with the comic stories published in black and white to match the B&W stories. THAT SAID, some SSOC stories DID end up, granted redrawn and censored to pass the Comic Code, reprinted in the Conan comic whenever the book had deadline issues in the 70s.

for me it was a mix bag.
I had sleep paraylsis three times. Once as a kid, I saw an UFO outside my window. Then as an adult I tried to cause sleep paraylsis intentionally. The first time I heard "God" as a voice. The second time I saw a burglar entering my room.

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
>>134481814
when you fall asleep, your body intentionally goes under a weak form of paralysis(so you don't do weird shit during your sleep, like roll of your bed)
so when you fall asleep but have your eyes open, you can still see everything, but due to being asleep, you also dream of weird stuff that then appears in your vision, causing a hallucination. Since you can't move due to the paralysis, but you can still see, and see weird shit on top of that, it can become pretty scary.
A demon sitting on your chest is commonly seen, because your lungs don't work normally when you're asleep, thus your brain tries to imagine a reason why that is. Thus something pressing down on your chest.
It's all science bro

In the Iberian countries, PlayStation was really popular. While PSP had faded from most of the western world, it had a rebirth in that market as a platform for children's games thanks to locally developed titles like Invizimals. But because of the platform's lack of visibility in the Anglosphere, there wasn't a lot from third parties. Sony's Iberian division funded new games based on Geronimo Stilton, ports of some Disney console tie-ins as well as some other licensed kids' show stuff alongside a few originals.

They attempted to carry that onward with Vita. Their first new game was to based on The Muppets. It launched the same year the movie with Rickey Gervais came out, so not the worst pick. Their second? A Looney Tunes sports mini-game collection that came out two years after The Looney Tunes Show ended.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_HveJJ4vE7A

(Their last collab was for a Phineas and Ferb game. The developer of that ported Across the Second Dimension to PSP and seemed to use the console version's engine as a base. The show ended the same year it launched, so not that bad. A game based on Mickey Mouse was announced, but not produced.)

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
>>134466680
If your story takes place across multiple planets there's no way in hell you have time to get into each of their histories, politics, culture, etc. so it's better to just condense it into something digestible for the viewer to understand, unless your story is literally about exploring each different planet. Otherwise why would you go to the trouble of fleshening out an entire world if its only purpose in the story is as a destination that the main character goes to when they're hunting a one-off bounty?

And the "planets being cities" thing never bothered me because I always just assumed we were seeing only one major city or locale on the planet anyway. It's not like we ever scale the entire planet from top to bottom in these stories.

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
>>134476826
Yeah but the issue is largely treating the planets as such. Though it's really only an issue because it's basically a cliche meant to simply convey what the message is about/ just make very simple straightforward factions/politics. It can probably be pretty easily avoided if you simply avoid trying to look too closely at the grandscale of Alien cultures. Your characters can just speak in terms of anecdote or a very specific point of culture rather than trying to give a grand overview.
